project1.title: Lego Builder
project1.description: This is an app where you can change the lego parts displayed by selecting specific parts from the dropdown buttons. You can save your favorite character! Practiced with promises and axios calls and intro to sass.
project1.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JS, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Axios, Postman

project2.title: Quidditch Roster
project2.description: This project is an exploration of SASS styling by creating a Quiddich roster for Hogwarts. Once loaded the user has the ability to filter the list of players by the house they belong to.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JS, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Axios, Postman

project3.title: Simple Pinterest
project3.description: A simple mock up of the look and functionality of Pinterest. You can check out the boards and upon clicking them, you will see the pins for that board. A project that introduced us to using Promises
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Bootstrap

project4.title: Shotz
project4.description: How to find the best locations for your movie shots! Alternate between shooting locations and the movies filmed there. Used promises and JSON.
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Modules, Promises

project5.title: What You See Is What You Get
project5.description: The story of Tomoe Gozen! Click and play around. DOM manipulation using Javascript, event listeners, and JSON files
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project6.title: Thrones
project6.description: A Game of Thrones site where you can sort characters based on their house. Project utilized to give us more experience with JS event listeners
project6.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project7.title: Adoption Website
project7.description: An adoption website where you are able to sort based on pet type (cat, dino, dog, or all). Very similar to the Thrones project in that it gave us more experience with event listeners.
project7.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github, Bootstrap

project8.title: Sorting Hat
project8.description: A project that brings Hogwarts' Sorting Hat to life! Users are able to sort students into Houses and expel them. Worked with event listeners (particularly click events).
project8.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
